title: U.S. Troops Won’t Face Charges in Kabul Airstrike That Killed 10 Civilians
sub_head: Investigators, senior officers, Defense Secretary Austin conclude mistakes leading to airstrike weren’t criminal
body:
WASHINGTON—No one in the U.S. military will face criminal charges in connection with an airstrike in Kabul that killed 10 civilians in the last days of the U.S. war in Afghanistan, the Pentagon said Monday.
The conclusion from Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin follows investigations conducted by the Pentagon, which the department described Monday as independent reviews.
